names.english: two roots and two vines decoction
names.commonEnglish: Two Roots and Two Vines Decoction

actions: Invigorates and tonifies the Blood, activates the channels and relaxes the sinews.
Dispels Wind-Dampness, unblocks the channels and collaterals, cools the Blood and reduces swellings.
With Mu Dan Pi, for Damp-Heat Bi with pain and swelling.
Tonifies Qi and Blood, strengthens the Spleen and relieves numbness and pain.
With Dang Shen, for Qi Deficiency with general debility, anorexia, fatigue, tired extremities and spontaneous sweating.
Tonifies the Middle Jiao, augments Qi, nourishes the Blood and promotes the generation of Body Fluids.
With Huang Qi, for Lung and Spleen Qi Deficiency with fatigue, shortness of breath, diarrhea and anorexia.
Nourishes Lung Yin, clears Lung Heat, nourishes Stomach Yin, generates fluids and tonifies Liver and Kidney Yin.
Clears Heat, cools the Blood nourishes Yin and generates fluids.
With Mu Dan Pi, for Kidney Yin Deficiency with steaming bones.
Clears Heat, cools and harmonizes the Blood, clears Deficiency Fire, invigorates the Blood and dispels Blood Stasis.
Clears Heat, cools the Blood, invigorates Blood circulation, relieves Fire toxins, encourages rashes, clears Damp-Heat from the skin and aids the healing of tissues.
Tonifies and nourishes Qi, Yin and Blood
syndromes: Qi, Blood and Yin Deficiency with Blood Stagnation and Heat

symptoms: Sweating with little or no exertion
Aching, soreness or weakness of low back
Pain, swelling and obvious tenderness in the superficial veins along the limbs or the thoracoepigastric walls
Hard cord-like swollen masses may be felt
In the affected areas, there is redness, swelling, pain, tenderness and cord-like masses,
manifestations.tongue: Red or Pale or Pale, thin and dry
manifestations.pulse: Thready and rapid or or Taut and rapid or Weak or Thin and choppy

modifications.purpose: initial-stage symptoms of fever, sore throat, macules and a red tongue
muscle pain and aversion to Cold due to Yang Deficiency with Wind-Damp
a chronic condition with more severe Blood Stagnation
